pageContext.claim: “[Responding to the question, ‘Did you tell Wayne LaPierre [[of the NRA]] that you would not pursue background checks, yesterday, in your call with him?’] No, I didn't say anything about that. We had a great talk with Wayne yesterday. Didn't say anything about that. We just talked about concepts. Wayne agrees things have to be done also.”
pageContext.analysis: It was widely reported, including by The Washington Post, that President Trump spoke with National Rifle Association chief executive Wayne LaPierre "and assured him that universal background checks were off the table."
